alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN CAROLINE AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Massaponax, or 8 miles south of Fredericksburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bowling Green, Port Royal, Fort A.p. Hill, Rappahannock Academy, Villboro, Nancy Wrights Corner, Guinea, Corbin, and Woodford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and east central Virginia.
